intro: Ranunculus ganeschinii var. lugensis, commonly known as the Lugens ranunculus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features compound leaves with a lobed structure and produces small, cup-shaped blooms in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
